channel.title: About Model Help Topics in the Wrong Place
channel.description:
We all know that some new people to the forums will ask for model help, and they don't notice the section. What do most of us do? We simply post "wrong section" and move on with our lives. NO SHIT its the wrong section, you don't have to restate it. Just report it to a moderator so it can be moved and go on your merry way.
From now on, if you see a model help topic in the wrong section, just help instead of making a pointless post, its spam and is not necessary.
Thanks.
And just so this can't get locked... [img]http://img42.imageshack.us/img42/3971/debu.png[/img](I'm a sneaky bastard)

item.title: About Model Help Topics in the Wrong Place
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

Assassin’s Creed Symbol. That’d hurt… right? Where do you hold it?

[size=1pt]wrong section.[/size]

Read full topic

item.title: About Model Help Topics in the Wrong Place
item.dc:creator: @Aesyr Aesyr
item.description:
@Aesyr wrote:

[quote=“Cole1497, post:14, topic:393577”][quote author=Aesyr link=topic=490746.msg3594217#msg3594217 date=1304909733]
I say don’t NOT tell them it’s the wrong section.

Tell them that it’s the wrong section, and to look next time before posting aimlessly throughout the forums hoping for approval from other members.
[/quote]
It’s okay to say it, but not for 11 people to post it in order to get their post count up.[/quote]

Exactly. At least provide some contribution if you’re going to post at all, I get the idea, and I agree completely.

Read full topic

item.title: About Model Help Topics in the Wrong Place
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

Its supposed to be heavy and simply slash people. Light enough to be carried with one hand, but heavy enough to slash effectively, breaking bones on the way. It would be swung a lot to get that force though, so its very slow, almost like the Barrelchest anchor, just grabbing your other arm for support instead of the weapon itself.

Read full topic
item.source: About Model Help Topics in the Wrong Place

Look, it needs some kind of backing. Maybe just some kind of guard or shock absorber so u don’t break ur shoulder.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

[quote=“rip4d, post:7, topic:393577”]Why not?

And you ARE all getting the point of this topic, right? Not just the model I posted?[/quote]
I am, I just felt that if I said “I agree 100%” it would pretty much totally contradict the basics of what you were talking about.
